author: Deepa H
text:
With the Central government bringing in a new Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, shopping at midnight for a birthday gift, indulging at a restaurant at 3 a.m., collecting a cheque book and picking up essentials whenever it suits you will soon be very much possible.

R. Heera, who works for a major IT firm in the city, welcomes the idea.

“Many times I stay at work till 1 a.m. or later, and when I’m going home almost nothing is open...sometimes I stop at either a 5-star hotel or a small roadside eatery for a bite. It would be nice if there was something in between...if the malls or restaurants were open, it would be very helpful not only for me, but also for everyone who works odd hours,” he said.

More employment

R. Srinivasan of the Tamil Nadu Hotels Association said the removal of restrictions on the number of working hours would help increase sales, bring in more employment, improve safety in cities since there would be people on the roads at all times and earn more taxes to the government.

“Already in Coimbatore, shops in railway stations and bus terminuses are open 24 hours. Similarly in Madurai, restaurants are open,” he pointed out.

President of the Multiplex Association of Tamil Nadu, Abirami Ramanathan, who welcomed the move, said that in countries like Singapore and Malaysia shops were open through the night.
title: Relaxation in shops’ working hours hailed
